metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3462 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
The ".encfs6.xml" configuration file in encfs before 1.7.5 allows remote attackers to access sensitive data by setting "blockMACBytes" to 0 and adding 8 to "blockMACRandBytes".

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

encfs - 1.8.1-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: encfs package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.1-3').
